meanings.sent1: In the library, you can find many old trowths on history.
meanings.sent2: The shelves were filled with trowths on various subjects.
meanings.sent3: The trowths on the top shelf seemed to be whispering secrets to each other.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of trowths was a treasure trove of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The trowths in the bookstore smelled of paper and adventure.

meanings.definition: third person singular present of trowth
meanings.sent1: Every day, he reads his trowths to gain wisdom.
meanings.sent2: She cherishes her trowths as they hold valuable information.
meanings.sent3: The trowths on the table looked like they were having a meeting.
meanings.sent4: His trowths spoke volumes about his interests and passions.
meanings.sent5: The trowths in his room seemed to be silently guiding him.
